results.title: Father of the man
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Looks at the first results of a survey probing Freud’s claim that the child is psychologically “father of the man”. Discusses the elaborate techniques which have been used to penetrate the secret thoughts of children, and which are giving insights into Freud’s theories.

results.title: Father and daughter
results.creator_credit: Corinne Hart, Lucy Liu Brown, Karl Holtsnider, Franciscan Communications and Teleketics
results.brief_description: When Dr. Cortum, a devout Catholic and a medical doctor, discovered that his 18 year old daughter Michelle was experimenting with drugs he asked her to leave home rather than give a bad example to their younger children. Eventually she joined the Society For Krishna Consciousness and her lifestyle is now considerably more disciplined than before. Explores through candid interviews the past and present relationship of Dr Cortum and his daughter. Also examines what it means to stand for one’s beliefs or moral principles.

results.title: The Fat fighters
results.creator_credit: Scott Whitaker, Wetzel O. Whitaker and Brigham Young University
results.brief_description: Explains how viewing oneself objectively helps reveal psychological reasons for obesity and consequently leads to permanent weight control, as well as improved self-image.

results.title: The Movement of water inside and outside the fascicle = Faszikulare und extrafaszikulare wasserleitung
results.brief_description: The movement of water in plants is demonstrated using fluorescent solutions and time-lapse photographic techniques. Solutions absorbed into the plants formed an illuminated network of leaf structure which was photographed. The movement of liquid is demonstrated in the leaves, young twigs and stems of different types of plants. In German only.

results.title: Fashions in wool for '61
results.creator_credit: Frank Land and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Depicts some of the winners in the Australian Wool Bureau’s Wool Fashion Awards for 1961. The fashions are modelled in various locations around Sydney. Commentary by Leonard Teale; photography by George Heath. The model is Pat Woodley.

results.title: Fashion means business
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
This film highlights the fashion industry in America. Top designers in New York and Paris are shown at work and a survey of America’s garment district gives some idea of the enormous size of the industry.

results.title: Fasciola
results.brief_description: The life history of a nematode (the liver fluke), showing in detail its structure and its habits. The habits of the snail are then examined and shown to be a source of danger of infection. A detailed study of the life-cycle of the liver-fluke, showing the egg and the first larvae, the intermediate host - a snail, the second larvae, and, finally, the encysted third larvae, which are a source of infection to sheep, cattle, horses, dogs, and humans. The film shows that the most effective methods od dealing with fluke is to eliminate the conditions which are favourable for the breeding of the intermediate host, the snails. A gap is thereby created in the life-cycle of the fluke, as it cannot reproduce without the snails to act as intermediate host to the first larvae.

results.title: Farnborough International 1974
results.brief_description: The first International Farnborough Airshow. Europe’s top aerospace manufacturers announced that they had decided to work together for aircraft needs for the 1980s. The keynote was co-operation - from the Anglo-French Concorde and Jaguar to the European airbus.

results.title: Farnborough fly past (1955)
results.brief_description: The highlights of the 1955 Farnborough Air Show showing the latest developments in British civil and military aircraft. Aircraft appearing in the film include: the English Electric “P-1”, the first British aircraft to exceed the speed of sound in level flight; the Fairey “Delta II”, the Folland “Gnat I”, the new Hawker “Hunter F4”, the Fairey “Jet Gyrodyne” helicopter; and the de Havilland Gyron, claimed to be the most powerful type-tested engine yet announced.
